FAQ.question: What is a Cadastral Map (Agriculture)?
FAQ.answer: A cadastral map is an official survey map showing precise boundaries, parcel identifiers, and measurements for agricultural land used for revenue and land management purposes.

FAQ.question: Why is the Cadastral Map important?
FAQ.answer: It is essential for boundary confirmation, land registration, dispute resolution, land consolidation, surveys, and planning agricultural activities.

FAQ.question: What details are needed to obtain a cadastral map?
FAQ.answer: You need the district, tehsil/taluk, village, survey/resurvey number, subdivision (if any), and owner/khata details.

FAQ.question: How long does it take to get the cadastral map?
FAQ.answer: If digitized maps are available it can be accessed immediately; otherwise retrieval or a fresh survey may take a few days.

FAQ.question: What information does a cadastral map contain?
FAQ.answer: It contains parcel boundaries, area measurements, adjoining parcel references, survey markers, and official parcel identifiers used by the revenue department.
